name: The European Group of Valuers' Associations
bossPosition: Chairman of the Board of Directors
membership: Common positions taken by TEGoVA with European Historic Houses Association, European Landowners' Organization, European Property Federation, Union Internationale de la Propriété Immobilière
goal:
Drafting and promoting European Valuation Standards (EVS) for adoption across Europe, and recommending a standard approach to valuation methodologies.

Setting minimum educational requirements with which members of European professional bodies for valuers must comply.

TEGoVA's Recognised European Valuer (REV) - designed to maintain, enhance and harmonise valuation standards and the valuation profession in Europe, and, by the granting of the status TEGoVA 'Recognised European Valuer' and designation REV to provide individual practising valuers in each member country with a well-defined indicator of qualification and experience, with the aim of assuring clients of their valuation proficiency.

TEGoVA Residential Valuer (TRV) - the mark of European excellence for residential valuers

Proposing to the European Central Bank a rewrite of its Asset Quality Review Manual's provisions on valuing banks' real estate collateral

Representing the views of the valuation profession to the European Union institutions during the policy making legislative process

Monitoring proper transposition of the valuation provisions of the Mortgage Credit Directive
interests: Climate Action, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Economic and Financial Affairs, Education, Energy, Enterprise, Environment, Financial Stability, Financial Services and Capital Markets Union , Internal Market, Taxation
euInitiatives:
Mortgage Credit Directive
The European Central Bank's Asset Quality Review

Energy efficiency policy - valuing energy performance certificates
